Text: Clive, the British inventor of the pocket calculator, upset with the lack of investment in his latest undertaking, an electric car, opposes former assistant Chris' belief that he can market a home computer chip. Differences result in Chris partnering with Austrian Hermann Hauser while utilizing Cambridge nerds to set up his own rival firm called Acorn. Clive's company Sinclair was outbid by Acorn to supply the BBC with equipment. A battle for supremacy ensues for the domestic market.
